intro: Eremostachys pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful spiny helenium, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its spiny stems and striking yellow-orange ray flowers surrounded by a series of tubular florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand hot, drought-prone environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Eremostachys pulchra is a perennial species that blooms in late summer to early fall, adding vibrant color to its native habitat.
